An attacker intercepted an RSA-encrypted message, but part of the private key leaked. Can you recover and decrypt the secret from this exposure? Ciphertext: 7819576063327837374599751159747510794844733167162827456394741139123322939939723663559184573685174709908616977546603905800148140593890367045854152785634135

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8706111592495157210408040982137688607990745879309305714586847784764301423824258983060527533009202723690696561021188548283158138974161953057484783970354297, e=1002916543420906790175619766613334420000049279530744392232828336619071669149949640981822312923997388971015880939721618983805112486149310662995464245428247, partial_p=14142316104050622908

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{8l33c4cs}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 7819576063327837374599751159747510794844733167162827456394741139123322939939723663559184573685174709908616977546603905800148140593890367045854152785634135
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8706111592495157210408040982137688607990745879309305714586847784764301423824258983060527533009202723690696561021188548283158138974161953057484783970354297, e=1002916543420906790175619766613334420000049279530744392232828336619071669149949640981822312923997388971015880939721618983805112486149310662995464245428247, partial_p=14142316104050622908
extra_info: p=88772756959123167180767124708661909742273579584559217324282229828075324344817, q=98071884784473070370113829464660130543925050668494626338923434247435856370441, Ï†(n)=8706111592495157210408040982137688607990745879309305714586847784764301423824072138418783936771651842736523238980902349652905085130498747393409272789639040
subtype: partial_key_exposure
archetype: rsa
